Sentencas: We describe the manufacturing of a solid-oxide fuel cell anode of NiO-8 mol.% Y2O3-stabilized ZrO2 with micro-scale continuous linear pores (CLPs) and nano-scale interparticle pore structures, achieved through thermal decomposition of unidirectional amorphous carbon fibers.
Titulo: Fabrication of continuous linear pores in an SOFC anode using unidirectional carbon fibers as sacrificial templates

Sentencas: The CLP structure prepared by this sacrificial templating method is characterized by its controllable uniform size, a tortuosity (ie, uniformity) of 1.003, and a coefficient of variation of 0.59.
Titulo: Fabrication of continuous linear pores in an SOFC anode using unidirectional carbon fibers as sacrificial templates

Sentencas: These highly regular CLPs are expected to minimize Knudsen diffusion, resulting in enhanced mass transport of hydrogen gas at the active sites, known as triple-phase boundary sites.
Titulo: Fabrication of continuous linear pores in an SOFC anode using unidirectional carbon fibers as sacrificial templates

Sentencas: Simulations using the Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) were used to determine the mass transport in the systems.
Titulo: Fabrication of continuous linear pores in an SOFC anode using unidirectional carbon fibers as sacrificial templates

Sentencas: An optimum diameter of 3 mu m and an interparticle pore size of 185 nm was shown to maximize the acceleration of mass transport of H-2 and maintain the number of TPB sites to minimize concentration overpotential.
Titulo: Fabrication of continuous linear pores in an SOFC anode using unidirectional carbon fibers as sacrificial templates

Sentencas: Thus, the proposed porous design can increase the energy efficiency of a solid-oxide fuel cell primarily by reducing the concentration overpotential.
Titulo: Fabrication of continuous linear pores in an SOFC anode using unidirectional carbon fibers as sacrificial templates
